Issues.Title: docs(router): Clarify 'parent' for params inheritance
Issues.Body:
When talking about parameter inheritance, one might think that matrix
parameters can be inherited from the "parent" segment, or the segment
which appears immediately to the left. In reality, when we talk about
a "parent" in the `Router`, we mean the parent `Route` config. This
config may contain more than one segment and matrix parameters must
appear at the end or they do not "belong" to any config.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "docs(router): Clarify 'parent' for params inheritance" (#40304)

Issues.Title: docs: fix misleading step in getting started routing
Issues.Body:
The [getting started routing step #4](https://angular.io/start/start-routing#associate-a-url-path-with-a-component) about updating the `*ngFor` is misleading because the user doesn't actually update it specifically, rather the update is made to the anchor tag, within the `*ngFor`. There is no change from the first step of the tutorial to the `*ngFor`. "As follows" is not followed by a code sample, instead the code sample is in the next step, which is confusing. This PR removes the reference to the `*ngFor` and moves the explanation into the next step, where it is more appropriate. The change goes from: ```

{{ product.name }}

``` to ```

{{ product.name }}

``` You don't edit `
` so there is no code snippet to pull for it. Fixes https://github.com/angular/angular/issues/40280
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "docs: fix misleading step in getting started routing" (#40316)

Issues.Title: Using formControlName in <form> tag is throwing error in Angular 11 but works with <div>
Issues.Body:
**So, I am seeing a weird issue in Angular 11.0.5.
I have nested form group structure which was working in Angular 9.1.0

form formGroupName="Switch" *ngIf="rule?.controls?.Switch"  -- Works in Angular 9 but doesn't work in Angular 11.

But when i change the form tag to div tag, it starts working again.

div formGroupName="Switch" *ngIf="rule?.controls?.Switch"  /div -- Work in both Angular 9 & 11.**
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Using formControlName in <form> tag is throwing error in Angular 11 but works with <div>" (#40298)

Issues.Title: Router exponentially slows down by increasing outlet count
Issues.Body:
# 🐞 bug report ### Affected Package The issue is caused by package @angular/router ### Is this a regression? Probably not. ### Description In our application, users can open multiple virtual windows. Each of them uses a router outlet to display content. The maximum number of openable windows is limited by the number of different outlets in the router config. Unfortunately, we found out, that increasing the number of sibling outlets with (the same) children routes leads to an exponential slowdown. The debugger shows that the Recognizer.processSegmentAgainstRoute function is causing the bad performance. In the provided stackblitz example this function takes the following times on my machine: 20 outlets - 10ms 200 outlets - 954ms 2000 outlets - 187000ms In our real project, these times are somewhat higher. So using a not unrealistic (20-30) number of windows already leads to long tasks. ## 🔬 Minimal Reproduction https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-ivy-ldbunw?file=src/app/app.module.ts Navigation will be slow when clicking the links. This is with 200 outlets with 2 children each. ## 🌍 Your Environment Also reproduced in Angular 10 on stackblitz. **Angular Version:** 

Angular CLI: 9.1.11
Node: 12.16.2
OS: win32 x64

Angular: 9.1.12
... animations, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... language-service, localize, platform-browser
... platform-browser-dynamic, router, service-worker
Ivy Workspace: Yes

Package                           Version
-----------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect         0.901.11
@angular-devkit/build-angular     0.901.11
@angular-devkit/build-optimizer   0.901.11
@angular-devkit/build-webpack     0.901.11
@angular-devkit/core              9.1.11
@angular-devkit/schematics        9.1.11
@angular/cdk                      9.2.4
@angular/cli                      9.1.11
@ngtools/webpack                  9.1.11
@schematics/angular               9.1.11
@schematics/update                0.901.11

Issues.Title: In Safari, using a SafeResourceUrl in <object> with type="application/pdf", crashes the entire tab
Issues.Body:
<!--🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅

Oh hi there! 😄

To expedite issue processing please search open and closed issues before submitting a new one.
Existing issues often contain information about workarounds, resolution, or progress updates.

🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅-->


# 🐞 bug report

### Affected Package
<!-- Can you pin-point one or more @angular/* packages as the source of the bug? -->
Using versions 10 and 11 of Angular


### Description
When using a `SafeResourceUrl` as data source of an `<object> element, in Safari 14.0.1 on MacOS Big Sur, the browser tab completely crashes.

The weird thing is, this only happens in combination when the attribute `type="application/pdf"` is added. 

I don't know if this is a Safari issue, or an Angular issue :(

## 🔬 Minimal Reproduction
<!--
Please create and share minimal reproduction of the issue starting with this template: https://stackblitz.com/fork/angular-ivy
-->
Below are 2 stackblitz links.
- One with the attribute set on the `<object>` element.
- Another without the attribute

**WITH attribute**
When clicking the button, this will crash your brower tab in Safari 14.0.1 on MacOS
https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-ivy-w8wyhq?file=src/app/app.component.html

**WITHOUT attribute**
When clicking the button, this will **NOT** crash your brower tab in Safari 14.0.1 on MacOS
https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-ivy-ucr2rf?file=src%2Fapp%2Fapp.component.html

## 🌍  Your Environment

**Angular Version:**
Angular 10 and 11 (haven't tested other versions)

**Anything else relevant?**
Only seems to happen in Safari 14.0.1 on MacOS Big Sur.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "In Safari, using a SafeResourceUrl in <object> with type="application/pdf", crashes the entire tab" (#40309)

Issues.Title: feat(router): Add helper function to retrieve all tree params
Issues.Body:
This commit adds a helper function that accepts an `ActivatedRouteSnapshot`
which combines all the params in the router state tree into a single object.

While this could be implemented relatively easily in user code, it requires
more in-depth knowledge of the router internals than should be necessary to
accomplish this task. In addition, it provides a starting point for
developers to reference if they require a more fine-tuned approach.

Fixes #11023
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "feat(router): Add helper function to retrieve all tree params" (#40306)

Issues.Title: feat(router): Add more find-tuned control in `routerLinkActiveOptions`
Issues.Body:
This commit adds more configurability to the `Router#isActive` method
and `RouterLinkActive#routerLinkActiveOptions`.
It allows tuning individual match options for query params and the url
tree, which were either both partial or both exact matches in the past.
Additionally, it also allows matching against the fragment and matrix
parameters.

fixes #13205

BREAKING CHANGE:
The type of the `RouterLinkActive.routerLinkActiveOptions` input was
expanded to allow more fine-tuned control. Code that previously read
this property may need to be updated to account for the new type.


Additional note on the breaking change: 
I found no places where `routerLinkActiveOptions` was read in g3. So while the type change is _technically_ breaking, it's possible that nobody will be affected.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "feat(router): Add more find-tuned control in `routerLinkActiveOptions`" (#40303)

Issues.Title: multiple NG9 angular elements consuming a service as a singleton using providedIn:platform
Issues.Body:
# 🐞 bug report

### Affected Package
@angular/core

### Is this a regression?
No
### Description

I was working on a personal project and had a use case where I needed to share a single instance of service (library) between multiple angular elements...

I understand that angular 9 came up with a new flag for the Injectable decorator (providedIn:platform) which is mainly to share one single instance of service (library) between multiple angular elements (applications). I wasn't able to find any sample project explaining how to use the flag.

According to angular documentation for the providedIn flag:

'platform' : A special singleton platform injector shared by all applications on the page.

However, as each angular element bundle was containing the service code within it individually, the flag didn't work for me.

I read in a github issue thread that I need to use ngx-build-plus to externalize the library, I externalized the library from the angular element and then had it as a global umd bundle.

I'm not seeing any of the service code within the angular element bundle, but still, I can see multiple instances of the service are running even when using the (providedIn:platform) flag, I suppose it's a bug.

I've seen people asking the same question on this forum and in StackOverflow as well but not getting proper guidance, I've tried it all, that's why if anyone can point to a sample project that we can learn from, or let me know what I'm missing, it would be very beneficial, thanks!

## 🔬 Minimal Reproduction

a page with two angular elements trying to consume an externalized umd library 'similar to RxJS', but not able to consume a single instance of it using (@injectable({providedIn:'platform'})

## 🔥 Exception or Error
No Error, but the service has multiple instances.

## 🌍  Your Environment

**Angular Version:**

Angular9
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "multiple NG9 angular elements consuming a service as a singleton using providedIn:platform" (#40301)

Issues.Title: Router tutorial: tour of heroes refers to non-existent code.
Issues.Body:
# 📚 Docs or angular.io bug report ### Description **Router tutorial: tour of heroes** refers to non-existent code. ## 🔬 Minimal Reproduction Follow the tutorial up to (and including) **Milestone 3: Heroes feature**. ### What's the affected URL?** [Router tutorial: tour of heroes](https://angular.io/guide/router-tutorial-toh) ### Reproduction Steps** 1. Complete the first two milestones. 2. Follow the instructions in [Add heroes functionality](https://angular.io/guide/router-tutorial-toh#add-heroes-functionality). 3. The [Route Parameters](https://angular.io/guide/router-tutorial-toh#route-parameters) section is where things start to get confusing. The text refers to this code ```html ``` but it doesn't seem to appear anywhere in the original Tour of Heroes tutorial; neither in [Part 4 (Services)](https://stackblitz.com/angular/dkjekblappg?file=src%2Fapp%2Fheroes%2Fheroes.component.html) nor in [Part 5 (In-App Navigation)](https://stackblitz.com/angular/lkeoljvavbl?file=src%2Fapp%2Fheroes%2Fheroes.component.html). 4. In the following section, [`ActivatedRoute` in action](https://angular.io/guide/router-tutorial-toh#activated-route-in-action), we're told to paste the following code in `ngOnInit()` ```typescript ngOnInit() { this.hero$ = this.route.paramMap.pipe( switchMap((params: ParamMap) => this.service.getHero(params.get('id'))) ); } ``` but this yields several compilation errors because neither the `hero$` property in `HeroDetailComponent` nor the `getHero` method in `HeroService` have been declared yet. (`getHero` is defined in Part 5 of the TOH Tutorial, but the page refers to Part 4.) The same section also contains this paragraph: > AsyncPipe handles the observable subscription and the component's hero property will be (re)set with the retrieved hero. However, `hero-detail.component.html` doesn't contain any references to `hero$`, nor does it contain the `async` pipe. It _does_ refer several times to the `hero` property, so I tried to replace these references with `(hero$ | async)` but this turns out to be illegal in the context of a two-way binding using `[(ngModel)]`. 5. The following section, [Navigating back to the list component](https://angular.io/guide/router-tutorial-toh#navigating-back-to-the-list-component), talks about the `HeroDetailComponent` "Back" button, but no such button exists in `hero-detail.component.html`. ### Expected vs Actual Behavior** It should be possible to follow along the instructions in this tutorial using the sample code. It seems that whoever wrote this tutorial was using a different version of the TOH tutorial. ## 📷Screenshot ## 🔥 Exception or Error
## 🌍 Your Environment ### Browser info ### Anything else relevant?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Router tutorial: tour of heroes refers to non-existent code." (#40299)

Issues.Title: Get direct access to ng-content input
Issues.Body:
# 🚀 Feature request Make content that comes in via `ng-content` more easily accessible. ### Description I would like to be able to give content to a component like this: ```html {{ content }} ``` And then get direct access to the content inside my component, e.g. via an injection or a special template variable. I have a more detailed description of how this should work here: [Render string input of ng-content directly as HTML](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/64733677/render-string-input-of-ng-content-directly-as-html) (StackOverflow) This also includes a StackBlitz of how I would like to avoid to do it (see [get-input-of-ng-content-directly](https://stackblitz.com/edit/get-input-of-ng-content-directly)). ### Describe the solution you'd like I would like to use it in the template directly, something like this: ```html
``` Or inject it like this: ```typescript constructor(ngContentStuff: NgContent) ``` ### Describe alternatives you've considered In the StackBlitz example I am getting the content via `ng-content` in the template and than access it via `elementRef.nativeElement.textContent`.

Issues.Title: refactor(router): refactor and simplify router RxJS chains
Issues.Body:
## PR Checklist
Please check if your PR fulfills the following requirements:

- [x] The commit message follows our guidelines: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit
- [ ] Tests for the changes have been added (for bug fixes / features)
- [ ] Docs have been added / updated (for bug fixes / features)


## PR Type
What kind of change does this PR introduce?

<!-- Please check the one that applies to this PR using "x". -->

- [ ] Bugfix
- [ ] Feature
- [ ] Code style update (formatting, local variables)
- [x] Refactoring (no functional changes, no api changes)
- [ ] Build related changes
- [ ] CI related changes
- [ ] Documentation content changes
- [ ] angular.io application / infrastructure changes
- [ ] Other... Please describe:

## Does this PR introduce a breaking change?

- [ ] Yes
- [x] No

## Other information

I refactored and simplified some RxJS usage in the Router package in order to reduce its size and increase performance. Unfortunatelly, I'm not able to verify the package size because `node ./scripts/build/build-packages-dist.js` fails on my system for some reason.

The biggest changes are these:
- Some custom operators were wrapped with another function even though they didn't need `source` Observable.
- `from([x, y, z])` is the same as `of(x, y, z)` and using `of()` should be faster (I'll need to test this).

There are some other usecases that seem suspicious like using `from().pipe(mergeAll())` should be the same as using just `merge()` but I'll need to be able to run `build-packages-dist.js` to make sure it generates smaller package.

Bundle size `main-es2015` in `cli-hello-world-lazy-rollup` integration test dropped from expected `218507` to `217931`.
Bundle size `main-es2015` in `cli-hello-world-lazy` integration test dropped from expected `241837` to `241260`.
So both bundles are cca 580 B smaller.

I'm not sure about the [removed records in `bundle.golden_symbols.json`](https://github.com/angular/angular/pull/40290/files#diff-0ea07045c567fb07c48994161c0a3bfa5bd1a676bc484d0fd8d3f9c5c2bc5d8d). It has probably something to do with this change https://github.com/angular/angular/pull/40290/files#diff-1706bbbdd4dda445171e80023d67b54f1aa77a457d6b81b6815239113fd34decR62-R66 but I'm not sure why.

I didn't make any change to existing tests because this should not break anything.

Issues.Title: Support custom chunks for webpack / separate chunks for in-house libraries
Issues.Body:
<!--🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅

Oh hi there! 😄

To expedite issue processing please search open and closed issues before submitting a new one.
Existing issues often contain information about workarounds, resolution, or progress updates.

🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅-->


# 🚀 Feature request


### Command (mark with an `x`)
<!-- Can you pin-point the command or commands that are relevant for this feature request? -->
<!-- ✍️edit: -->
- [ ] new
- [x] build
- [x] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [ ] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update
- [ ] lint
- [ ] extract-i18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc

### Description
<!-- ✍️--> A clear and concise description of the problem or missing capability...
We do most of our component development in an Angular library. That library is linked via package.json (local file reference as it is in a mono-repo style git repository). This library is quite large and it takes time for webpack to re-pack it. The contents get put into `vendor.js` as we have `vendorChunk` set to true. It would be nice to be able to have our library be able to be put in its own chunk file so that the vendor chunk rarely ever changes during a release (it is uncommon for us to change other packages during a release).

While this may be possibly using tools like `@angular-builders/custom-webpack:browser` it would be nice to have greater customization of the chunks that are created via the core builder and angular.json.

### Describe the solution you'd like
<!-- ✍️--> If you have a solution in mind, please describe it.
New `additionalChunks` section of angular.json configuration for the `@angular-devkit/build-angular:browser` builder.
It would allow glob matching to customize the chunks.

```
"additionalChunks": {
    "myLib": [ "node_modules/myLib/**" ]
}
```

This would package the "myLib" Angular library as "myLib.[hash].js" in the output of ng build (and a separate file for serve)

### Describe alternatives you've considered
<!-- ✍️--> Have you considered any alternative solutions or workarounds?
`@angular-builders/custom-webpack:browser`

Instead of:

```
@import ../../../../../../somepackage.css
```

But we can't do this (For example):

```
  styleUrls: ['~@fireflysemantics/help-center-css/components/topic-meta.component.css']

```

We have to do this:

```
  styleUrls: ['../../../../node_modules/@fireflysemantics/help-center-css/components/topic-meta.component.css']
```

It would be nice if we could use `~` throughout as something that just points to `node_modules` ...
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Resolve ~ to node_modules universally (Also in ng-packagr)?" (#19703)

Issues.Title: AngularJS => Angular migration and ng-annotate
Issues.Body:
# 🚀 Feature request

### Description

Pretty much these other issues explain the motivations for my feature request: https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/issues/6873 by @yjaaidi and https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/issues/3722 by @Itrulia

I'm migrating an app from AngularJs to Angular, and even when building for production I'm needing to specify `--optimization=false` because otherwise, the AngularJs parts of my app won't work. The reason is when using Angular CLI there is no way of including `ng-annotate` as part of the pipeline for the AngularJs bits.

What is the 2021 way of using ng-annotate for hybrid applications?

Thanks.

### Describe the solution you'd like
I would like a "plugins" section where I could specify "ng-annotate" and only for files that match a regex (the AngularJs files).

### Describe alternatives you've considered
I've considered:
1. **Ejecting the configuration and not using ng-cli.** I don't like this solution as I want to use Angular CLI and reduce customizations (so upcoming upgrades are smoother).
1. **Running ng-annotate on each of the Angular files by hand, and permanently replacing the original files.** But it's rather involved, I'd need to write a script that:
    - Removes the imports from the top of my files (because ng-annotate doesn't like "imports/exports" in non-module files).
    - Runs ng-annotate in each one, redirecting the output to a file, then swapping the files.
1. **Continuing to use the non-optimized version of my product in production**. My company's product is quite large, and it is taking several seconds to download and bootstrap, so this is exactly what I want to avoid.
1. **Using a custom webpack config prepended to ng-cli's one.** I found it [here](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/59302237/how-to-use-ng-annotate-with-hybrid-app-based-on-angular-cli).

So far it looks like number 4 is what I'm going to try, otherwise doing number 2. Unless there is already a better solution I have not considered.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "AngularJS => Angular migration and ng-annotate" (#19692)

Issues.Title: Build optimizer breaks custom web element library
Issues.Body:
# 🐞 bug report ### Affected Package This issue is caused by @angular/compiler ### Is this a regression? This did not work as far back as v. 9. ### Description When installing a custom web element library (specifically @microsoft/fast-components) through node with the custom elements schema enabled, the custom web elements render fine in development mode. However, when building the application in the default "production" configuration with `buildOptimizer` set to true, the custom elements will cause a "call stack size exceeded" error. This error does not happen normally on these elements. ## 🔬 Minimal Reproduction Pull the repro from [here](https://github.com/tgoze/ng-build-optimizer-custom-web-el-repro). This is a base Angular 11 project with @microsoft/fast-components installed. The components are included as instructed on this [site](https://www.fast.design/docs/integrations/angular). ### Normal behavior: 1. Pull the repo 2. Run `npm i` 3. Run `npm start` 4. Open localhost:4200 5. See a simple textbox and radio button rendered and no console errors ### Reproduce error: 1. Run `npm start-prod` 2. Open localhost:5005 3. Observe the console error and the radio button un-rendered If `buildOptimizer` in angular.json for the production mode is set to `false` the error will not occur for `npm start-prod`. ## 🔥 Exception or Error

Issues.Body:
[![WhiteSource Renovate](https://app.renovatebot.com/images/banner.svg)](https://renovatebot.com)

This PR contains the following updates:

| Package | Change | Age | Adoption | Passing | Confidence |
|---|---|---|---|---|---|
| [sass](https://togithub.com/sass/dart-sass) | [`1.30.0` -> `1.32.0`](https://renovatebot.com/diffs/npm/sass/1.30.0/1.32.0) | [![age](https://badges.renovateapi.com/packages/npm/sass/1.32.0/age-slim)](https://docs.renovatebot.com/merge-confidence/) | [![adoption](https://badges.renovateapi.com/packages/npm/sass/1.32.0/adoption-slim)](https://docs.renovatebot.com/merge-confidence/) | [![passing](https://badges.renovateapi.com/packages/npm/sass/1.32.0/compatibility-slim/1.30.0)](https://docs.renovatebot.com/merge-confidence/) | [![confidence](https://badges.renovateapi.com/packages/npm/sass/1.32.0/confidence-slim/1.30.0)](https://docs.renovatebot.com/merge-confidence/) |

---

### Release Notes

<details>
<summary>sass/dart-sass</summary>

### [`v1.32.0`](https://togithub.com/sass/dart-sass/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#​1320)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/sass/dart-sass/compare/1.30.0...1.32.0)

-   Deprecate passing non-`%` numbers as lightness and saturation to `hsl()`,
    `hsla()`, `color.adjust()`, and `color.change()`. This matches the CSS
    specification, which also requires `%` for all lightness and saturation
    parameters. See [the Sass website][color-units] for more details.

-   Deprecate passing numbers with units other than `deg` as the hue to `hsl()`,
    `hsla()`, `adjust-hue()`, `color.adjust()`, and `color.change()`. Unitless
    numbers _are_ still allowed here, since they're allowed by CSS. See [the Sass
    website][color-units] for more details.

-   Improve error messages about incompatible units.

-   Properly mark some warnings emitted by `sass:color` functions as deprecation
    warnings.

##### Dart API

-   Rename `SassNumber.valueInUnits()` to `SassNumber.coerceValue()`. The old name
    remains, but is now deprecated.

-   Rename `SassNumber.coerceValueToUnit()`, a shorthand for
    `SassNumber.coerceValue()` that takes a single numerator unit.

-   Add `SassNumber.coerceToMatch()` and `SassNumber.coerceValueToMatch()`, which
    work like `SassNumber.coerce()` and `SassNumber.coerceValue()` but take a
    `SassNumber` whose units should be matched rather than taking the units
    explicitly. These generate better error messages than `SassNumber.coerce()`
    and `SassNumber.coerceValue()`.

-   Add `SassNumber.convertToMatch()` and `SassNumber.convertValueToMatch()`,
    which work like `SassNumber.coerceToMatch()` and
    `SassNumber.coerceValueToMatch()` except they throw exceptions when converting
    unitless values to or from units.

-   Add `SassNumber.compatibleWithUnit()`, which returns whether the number can be
    coerced to a single numerator unit.

</details>

Issues.Title: Base libs and apps settings in angular.json
Issues.Body:
<!--🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅

Oh hi there! 😄

To expedite issue processing please search open and closed issues before submitting a new one.
Existing issues often contain information about workarounds, resolution, or progress updates.

🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅-->


# 🚀 Feature request

### Description
We have many libs and apps in our monorepo. The problem is that most settings for libs in angular.json are identical, same for apps. We have few thousand lines of code in our angular.json, but it could be greatly reduced if we have base settings which can be overrided.

### Describe the solution you'd like
Add base settings for all libs/apps in angular.json which can be overrided by app or lib itself.

Issues.Title: bug(mat-dialog): The typing for `_closeDialogVia` method is invalid
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

Try to use `_closeDialogVia` method with a `MatDialogRef<T, R>` where `T` and `R` are different types (probably the most common case).

StackBlitz (really abstract example here, but it shows the behavior):
https://stackblitz.com/edit/dialog-ref-closing-issue?file=src%2Fapp%2Fexample-component.ts

#### Expected Behavior

What behavior were you expecting to see?

TypeScript compiler should allow to use `_closeDialogVia` method with a `MatDialogRef<T, R>` instance where `T` and `R` are different types.

#### Actual Behavior

What behavior did you actually see?

TypeScript compiler complains about the types of `result` parameter being incompatible with what is provided as an argument.

- CDK/Material: 10.2.1
- Browser(s): N/A

Issues.Title: bug(FocusMonitor): Focus origin of already focused element doesn't change if FocusMonitor is on parent with checkChildren set to true.
Issues.Body:
#### Explanation

The fix https://github.com/angular/components/pull/20966 made it so that the focus origin of an already focused element should change if `focusVia` is called on the element. Unfortunately, this doesn't appear to work if the `FocusMonitor` is on a parent element and set up with `checkChildren = true`. This is because the check here (https://github.com/angular/components/pull/20966/files#diff-02e96e7ea6a7d8f1caecdfdbb7cb38bdcdc5c43db34e4392723cc48765e330b7R316) fails, as `nativeElement` doesn't have a registered `FocusMonitor`. The `FocusMonitor` is instead registered on the parent.

#### Reproduction

Stackblitz: https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-ivy-un8eee?file=src/app/hello.component.ts

Steps to reproduce:
1. Open DevTools and watch the classes on `document.body`. There is a `FocusMonitor` attached to the `document.body`.
1. Click on the button "Focus test button with origin". Note that the class `.cdk-mouse-focused` is first added, and then 5 seconds later, is replaced by the class `.cdk-keyboard-focused`. This is expected behavior. When this button is clicked, it calls `focusVia` wth `keyboard` origin on the "Test" button after 5 seconds.
1. Now, again click on the button "Focus test button with origin". After clicking, and within 5 seconds, click on the button "Test". Now observe that the class `.cdk-mouse-focused` is present, and never changes to `.cdk-keyboard-focused`. **This is not expected behavior.** I'd expect the class to change to `.cdk-keyboard-focused` due to the fix https://github.com/angular/components/pull/20966. Unfortunately it doesn't, because the check `this._elementInfo.has(nativeElement)` fails within `focus-monitor.ts`.

#### Environment

- Angular: Latest
- CDK/Material: Latest
- Browser(s): All
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): All
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(FocusMonitor): Focus origin of already focused element doesn't change if FocusMonitor is on parent with checkChildren set to true." (#21500)

Issues.Title: bug(mat-autocomplete): autoActiveFirstOption selects disabled <mat-option>
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

StackBlitz: https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-qrv3v7?file=src/app/autocomplete-auto-active-first-option-example.html

Steps to reproduce:
1. Search for "AB" in the form field
2. Notice that the first option (AB) is automatically active
3. Notice that the first option is greyed out because it is a disabled <mat-option>
 
 
#### Expected Behavior
The first _active_ <mat-option> should be automatically selected if autoActiveFirstOption is set for the <mat-autocomplete>. This is the behavior when using the arrow up/down keys that any disabled <mat-option> are not highlighted as you use the arrow up/down keys. In this example, the option "ABC" should be automatically active since it is the first _active_ <mat-option> that matches the autocomplete search text.


#### Actual Behavior
In the example, the first <mat-option> becomes active, regardless of if it has its `disabled` input property set to true.


#### Environment

- Angular: 11.0.0
- CDK/Material: 11.0.0
- Browser(s): Chrome 87.0.4280.88
- Operating System: macOS 10.15.7
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(mat-autocomplete): autoActiveFirstOption selects disabled <mat-option>" (#21498)

Issues.Title: fix(material/select): NVDA reading out table when opening select on Chrome
Issues.Body:
The `mat-select` trigger element has an `aria-owns` pointing to the overlay and `display: inline-table` in its CSS. The combination of these two causes Chrome to infer the element as a `table` which results in NVDA reading out "table" any time a select is opened.

These changes resolve the issue by setting the element to `role="presentation"`. I've tested out the change against NVDA and VoiceOver and it doesn't seem to affect the accessibility of the select, apart from the "table" not being read out anymore.

Fixes #21480.

For reference, here's what Chrome's constructed a11y node looks like at the moment (note the `LayoutTable`).

![Example](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4450522/103535563-9ca5b380-4e99-11eb-8739-3d631cfd5ad3.png)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(material/select): NVDA reading out table when opening select on Chrome" (#21492)

Issues.Title: VoiceOver reads out "selected" after each mat-option inside mat-select
Issues.Body: I noticed this after updating to Big Sur and trying out `mat-select` with VoiceOver. While navigating through the list of options, VoiceOver reads out something like "Coffee, selected (5 of 10)" for every single option. My first thought was that it might be due to the fact that we remove `aria-selected` from unselected options in order to reduce noise, but the behavior got even weirder once I got it to set `aria-selected="false"`. Now VoiceOver started reading out both "not selected" and "selected" for each option, e.g. "Coffee not selected, selected (5 of 10)". We'll have to investigate this, because I don't see anything obvious that could be causing it. My best bet is that there's a random "selected" string somewhere in the DOM that is being picked up by VoiceOver.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "VoiceOver reads out "selected" after each mat-option inside mat-select" (#21491)

Issues.Title: feat(google-maps): add heatmap support
Issues.Body:
Adds support for rendering heatmaps on the `google-map` component using the `map-heatmap-layer` directive. The directive is mostly a direct wrapper around the `google.maps.visualization.HeatmapLayer` class, except for the fact that it also accepts a `LatLngLiteral`, whereas the Google Maps class only accepts `LatLng` objects. I decided to add some logic to convert them automatically, because creating `LatLng` requires the Maps API to have been loaded which can lead to race conditions if it's being loaded lazily.

![Example](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4450522/103477692-e45d0a00-4dc9-11eb-9f92-6a8f7b2c4614.png)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "feat(google-maps): add heatmap support" (#21489)

Issues.Title: feat(material/datepicker): add support for cancel/apply buttons
Issues.Body:
Adds support for projecting in "Cancel" and "Apply" buttons in `mat-datepicker` and `mat-date-range-picker`. Doing so will change the behavior of the datepicker so that the user has to explicitly accept a value after they've clicked on it. The consumption is as follows:

```
<mat-datepicker>
  <mat-datepicker-actions>
    <button mat-button matDatepickerCancel>Cancel</button>
    <button mat-raised-button color="primary" matDatepickerApply>Apply</button>
  </mat-datepicker-actions>
</mat-datepicker>
```

The result looks like this:
![Example](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4450522/103455069-5b26d400-4cf2-11eb-8919-5f389c2506cb.png)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "feat(material/datepicker): add support for cancel/apply buttons" (#21487)

Issues.Title: help(Datepicker): Handle navigation by keyboard through calendar months
Issues.Body:
#### What are you trying to do?

I'm trying to find a way to handle navigation by keyboard through calendar months. Using a tab key on my keyboard I'm able to switch calendar view to the previous/next month, but I don't found any events that can emit any info about this process.

Additional info: I use custom **calendar header** + **mat-calendar**

#### What troubleshooting steps have you tried?

I have tried to subscribe to the calendar stateChanges subject. But there no info about the current/previous/next month date. Active date - it is a date which one is selected.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/24374130/103411947-9a7ee480-4b7b-11eb-9bf9-efe8181aac97.png)
On the left side - the date navigated by a key tab. At the right side - selected (current date)

I saw PR https://github.com/angular/components/pull/3655, but there are no events to inform the user about view changes.

#### Reproduction

Easy can be reproduced here with the first calendar example.
https://material.angular.io/components/datepicker/examples

Steps to reproduce:
1. Open calendar.
2. Use the tab to move to the calendar.
3. User arrows on the keyboard to change the day.
  
#### Environment

- Angular: 10
- CDK/Material: 10
- Browser(s): Google Chrome
- Operating System: Windows 10
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "help(Datepicker): Handle navigation by keyboard through calendar months" (#21485)

Issues.Title: update to google fonts version 2
Issues.Body:
#### Feature Description

now when you run `ng add @angular/materia` and select yes for `Set up global Angular Material typography styles?` it adds version 1 of google fonts, while now there is a newer version

most importantly it doesn't include the `<link rel="preconnect" href="https://fonts.gstatic.com">` that should makes improvement for loading the fonts and reducing First Contentful Paint time according to [web.dev](https://web.dev/uses-rel-preconnect/)

#### Use Case

i'm not sure how this works, but currently the output is

```
<link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/css?family=Roboto:300,400,500&display=swap" rel="stylesheet">
```

but it should be

```
<link rel="preconnect" href="https://fonts.gstatic.com">
<link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/css2?family=Roboto:wght@300;400;500&display=swap" rel="stylesheet">
```

if anyone can point me to the right direction i can do the PL myself
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "update to google fonts version 2" (#21478)
